intro: Sabulina rostrata, commonly known as the rostrate saxifrage, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or tundra environments. The plant has small, spoon-shaped leaves that are usually covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a distinctive elongated spur at the base. Sabulina rostrata plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil in harsh environments.
